posts.post_content:
Hey guys.

Will post pictures when I get home, but, wanted to get a thread started in case anyone had any immediate questions or desires with these types of cards. 

I have 7 T206 Philadelphia cards I've upgraded over the past few months and I'm looking to sell (or trade).  Most I've gotten from folks here and you could find the threads where I bought them.  Not flipping to make money, just moving them on to the next person.  

As of now, looking for $13 PP gift a piece which breaks me even.  I'll cover shipping.  

Note, all are in rough to beater condition so expect bends and stains.  I'll describe here mostly noting any paper loss and overall condition and post pictures when I get home from work.  

Thanks!  

Nicholls Fielding - Piedmont 350 - very, very rough front, paper loss, bends, etc.  Pure "beater".  Could do this one cheaper than $13, I overpaid.  

Doolan Fielding - Piedmont 350 - stained and some paper loss front

Dygert Portrait - Sweet Cap 350 - clean looking front, back has top and bottom semi-circle paper loss.  Prob best "looking" card of the group.

Covaleski Standing - Piedmont 150 - sold to me as top trimmed and I believe that to be the case.  Otherwise front clean.  Back has some paper loss.

Hartsel Standing - Sweet Cap 350 - front has top paper loss down to the top of his head.  Back has slight paper loss at top.  

Jacklitsch Fielding - Sovereign 150 - front clean.  card has bend in top right.  back has some paper loss at bottom

McQuillian Batting - Piedmont 350 - has 3 major bends.  One right down the middle vertically and 2 horizontally.  some paper loss on front.  Back otherwise ok with no paper loss.

[img]http://farm9.staticflickr.com/8479/8230231123_16dd610d8b_c.jpg[/img]
[img]http://farm9.staticflickr.com/8337/8230231657_407b6a2cd5_c.jpg[/img]
Added pictures to the OP.  thanks.

PM sent on
Doolan Fielding
Jacklitsch Fielding
McQuillian Batting
